ol.li:
When a fall happens, another employee (Rescuer who has been previously trained in rescue procedures and rescue equipment handling) needs to assess the situation and make contact with the fallen worker, determining their status to consider if the fallen employee can self-rescue or not. If not, they check if the fallen person is conscious or not. If not conscious, they call the external Emergency service before starting the rescuing procedure.
WARNING: If a person hangs motionless for longer periods (10-20 minutes) in the full body harness, health risks can arise (hanging trauma: orthostatic shock, danger to life).
In the meantime, the emergency services will need to be contacted and the company alerted about the accident.
Rescuer performs a visual and functional check of rescue equipment before use.
Rescuer or another person has to clear and secure work areas where the rescue will take place, while they remain safe or if any ongoing work would obstruct a rescue.
The next step is to immediately implement the rescue procedure in accordance with the company policy and safety guidelines.

Consider usage of rescue kits which for example allow you to either lower the person to the ground or lift them up, depending on the situation. Make sure that the rescue kit is present at the point of work prior to the work commencing.

If someone has fallen over an edge, Rescuer needs to consider the additional friction encountered when trying to raise the fallen worker, the anchor line being at a risk of cutting and generally be aware of the edge interfering with the rescue equipment.
If an immediate rescue solution is not available, then try to support the fallen worker’s feet to make the restraint a bit more bearable.
